sentences.sContent: Try to express yourself more simply.
sentences.sCn: 尽量把你的意思表达得更简单明了。

sentences.sContent: To put it simply, the tax cuts mean the average person will be about 3% better off.
sentences.sCn: 简单地说，这次减税意味着普通人的收入将增加 3% 左右。

sentences.sContent: We had to live very simply on my father’s small salary.
sentences.sCn: 我们只能靠父亲微薄的工资过着非常简朴的生活。

sentences.sContent: ...and a lack of curiosity is a problem are such accusations simply efforts to score political points for one's party...
...or has the industry simply hired better interior designers...
...He will simply lose part of his pay...
...simply offering a healthy option may not be good enough...
...Good conversation skills include much more than simply talking to others...
...and multitasking is simply a　fact of life for many medical jobs...
...We've all met the type of Individual who simply must take charge...

...What Leeson terms "the Warren Buffett effect" is becoming more broadly appealing as individuals come to "view retirement as not simply being linked to economic productivity but also about contribution...
...the company is simply making changes to improve its service...
...These changing life styles are responsible for the increasing number of people who must rush meals or sometimes simply go without them...

synos.tran: 简单地；仅仅；简直；朴素地；坦白地

phrases.pCn: 简支梁；简单支撑梁；简支架

words.tran: 笨蛋；愚蠢的行为；出身低微者

trans.tranOther: if you say or explain something simply, you say it in a way that is easy for people to understand
